abstract: Swede David Lagercrantz, literary fiction and biography writer, waits nervously for reaction to latest work, The Girl in the Spider's Web, sequel to Stieg Larsson’s bestselling trilogy about girl with large dragon tattoo; deceased author’s father and brother asked Lagercrantz to continue trilogy, but request was met with vehement opposition by Eva Gabrielson, Larsson’s longtime companion.
lead_paragraph: David Lagercrantz, the author of the new sequel to the “Millennium” trilogy, talks about living up to a legacy while also creating something distinctive.

headline.main: In Stieg Larsson’s Head, but His Own Man
headline.print_headline: Inheriting ‘Dragon Tattoo,’ With a Measure of Fear and Pride

snippet: David Lagercrantz, the author of the new sequel to the “Millennium” trilogy, talks about living up to a legacy while also creating something distinctive.
